name: palecur
text: Liebot and Philippe, always good for yuks.

name: mr_pete
text: It is hard to have thousands of deaths from inaction draped on your shoulders when you are a young man.

name: relaxing
text: Think this one out, kid.

name: epicurus
text: This is quite the ethical conundrum. I believe that the Otter And the Robot was one of Aesop's fables.

name: woodenteeth
text: Same violence. Same dubious moral lessons.

name: draykid
text: Wait, what's dubious about Aesop's moral lessons? He made a lot of great interjections.

name: woodenteeth
text: The punishment often far outweighed the crime, and almost always came from an external source to the child's rationale.

name: draykid
text: Oh, I understand what you mean then. Chubby for a good point.

name: daidai
text: It's a falcon, and yes.

name: hastooo
text: A comment left by hastooo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, tekende, apocowarg, zcross00, hellofyellin, riotdejaneiro, atom, Projectyl, StoatLad, Thorfinn, fourganger, Jesler729, Pseudochron, Leon_Sumbitches, Moraiat, regrepnsnefpoh, Ebessan, Art-Vader, Axhoola, BrianNotBrian, fmercury, RBisme, aesop_punk, Fcannon, brotherbrian, zaer, Boredom_Man, Xaxx, holly_golightly, w_t_f, Pigs)

name: saint
text: A comment left by saint was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Pan-Optic, smugairle, Zoltan)

name: straw
text: John Rocker does it better. He has that impression down .

name: johnnyrocker
text: Are you... Are you talking about me?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: hah. sorry for the confusion, jay

name: slalvation
text: People do that because it used to be that you could not see the alt text in the archives, or whatever. It was helpful, I assume.

name: xiaomimi
text: I deeply dread a future day when blog entries suddenly appear in a nice side panel on AssetBar.  I have nought but sympathy for the early alt-texters.

name: rowboat
text: Well until then, bravo. It has revolutionized the way I peruse.

name: mysterymeat1001
text: Heartily seconded.

name: tekende
text: Amen!

name: woodenteeth
text: Testify!

name: spinynorman
text: R-E-S-P-E-C-T

name: jhunter
text: Otis Redding or Aretha Franklin?

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Heh.

xiaomimi once thought that assetbar would, in the future, have more options.

Heh.

name: xiaomimi
text: It was a different time then, before the fall.

name: deancain29
text: Liebot lays it out for Philippe

name: dracer2
text: A comment left by dracer2 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by GSurge, mysterymeat, Darthemed)

name: spectre
text: Nobody should ga-rontee unless they can cook like Justin Wilson. That is rare.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: That you know this is a good thing the children should gather at your feet and learn. The cajun ga-ron-tee is the sacred ga-ron-tee that making and breaking, LieBot ga-ron-tees himself a place in the dissolving sludgepits of everlasting RecycleBotHell.

name: doublebatman
text:
I read ga-ron-tee in a robot voice, and it's hilarious.

Like, Ga. Ron. Tee.

name: feetnotes
text: Surely he could visit Ultra Peanut?

name: ffwhhros12
text: I was under the impression she was Japanese?

name: psquid
text:
WHY FIND OUT

Pretty sure she is Chinese.

name: peterjoel
text: If only the whole world could convert to Americanism.

name: killerlimpet
text: But then who would we invade?

name: pogo
text: We could always invade your ass.

name: tekende
text: pogo's working some rough chuckles!

name: killerlimpet
text: I will just warn you, you WILL find chemical weapons there.

name: soticoto
text: Then the whole world would be dead.

name: jeet
text: Digging a hole to China is marvelous.

name: oldmanmusic
text: i was listening to lastfm radio and the song that came on when i got here was from an album called Dig Your Own Hole. baha

name: saru
text:
Just so you know, assuming it was in any way possible to dig straight through the entire Earth, you'd actually come out about five hundred miles south-east of Madagascar.
If you wanted to come out in Sichuan, you'd need to start in Chile.

name: zem
text: you mean lie bot was not telling the truth ????

name: njury
text: I wanted to chubby this, but apparently I'm at the limit :(. I'm sorry.

name: soticoto
text:
So where would you have to start to come out five hundred miles off the coast of Madagascar?

I'm fairly sure if I dug my way from here I'd come out just off the coast of New Zealand.

name: machegav
text: http://www.antipodemap.com/

name: aelindil
text: Well, I know how I'm going to be wasting the next few hours!

name: soticoto
text: Besides... they'd just close their shores.

name: dartigen
text:
These sorts of comments is the reason why without the comments section, Achewood could not be as entertaining. Its entertainment value would be multiplied by 0.75.
Chubbied because this is awesome.

name: kalethan
text: "Just use the Find-Your-Opposite tool link in the sidebar! In some places it's almost impossible. Mine, for example, is in the Indian Ocean.(notes)- As I lay this bread on the ground, I know my job ain't done. It leaves the Earth open-faced and overexposed to the sun...but if the earth were a sandwich..."

name: stwee
text: what's the voice that Liebot is using when he 'ga-ron-tees' it? I'm thinking a used car salesman from the South with a cowboy hat and those weird Texan neckties that look like shoelaces. But i might be wrong. Any suggestions?

name: phthoggos
text: i just hope it's not Gambit from the X-Men cartoon

name: rowboat
text: It most closely resembles the Cajun dialect. This is the way Louisiana swamp people talk.

name: achilleselbow
text:
You're all wrong (except rowboat).

It's what Leatherhead from TMNT used to say all the time. You know, the alligator guy.

name: rowboat
text:
Also, for anyone here old enough to remember the 80's (I know there are a few of you out there), this pronunciation of the word "guarantee" was popularized by Justin Wilson, the Cajun Cook. I happen to be at that special in-between age which allows me to have intimate knowledge both of 80's cooking shows and the Ninja Turtles.

Lucky me.

name: professorhazard
text: Everyone except rowboat needs to take a lap for not knowing the majesty of Justin Wilson .

name: spectre
text: AMEN!

name: scifigrl47
text: Oh, thank God, I wasn't the only one, mon ami.

name: greenkoolayd
text: its called a bolo tie, inspector doofie.

name: tourach3
text:
we tried this once
it kept raining and filling in the hole

name: xiaomimi
text:
Wednesday Blogs

Teodor: Weird call from Ray

name: dasuta
text:
that's the way people who shop in supermarkets near where I live offer testimonials. Sound something like "Gair-uhn-tea" scary stuff.

Aside: If it was meant for more than one tooth, it would be called teethpaste.

name: tttt2
text: Lie Bot presents Philippe with an ethical dilemma that doesn't actually exist

name: pogo
text: I am officially sick of Lie Bot, no lie.

name: woodenteeth
text: Why Pogo? Do you not find his schtick amusing anymore? Do you tire of him?

name: pogo
text: Hmm, that was two months ago, and I haven't seen Liebot since.  I guess I feel that character is too predictable, and I also don't like lies.

name: woodenteeth
text: [insert meta-discussion re: lies and fiction]

name: boredom_man
text: How do you not like lies ? I can understand not liking people , but you're basically saying, "I don't like samsara." How you gonna pull that one off?

name: redzerostar
text: so the first 2 or 3 times i read this strip, i read it as "an important yet violent doctor." funny in a completely different way.

name: fattypneumonia
text: I originally read it as "an impotent but violent dictator."  Well, yeah, naturally he'd be a little upset....

name: ryaldin
text: If Liebot had even one iota of mercy in his dealings with Philippe, my head would explode from not being able to deal with it.

name: clever-nickname
text: Phillipe hasn't aged one iota. How does he do it?

name: aelindil
text: Stem cells.

name: mrectomy
text: I have this theory that Pat invented Lie Bot for the sole purpose of making his friends' lives even more difficult for when he can't be there.

name: rodjmeister
text: Oh Phillippe.

name: sparhawk
text: The otter child serves as a metaphorical hackeysack for the deceitful tin bastard.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: There should be a children's book titled The Otter Child and the Deceitful Tin Bastard Play Hackeysack

name: dusty
text: How is it that I know those shoes are reddish brown and white even though they aren't colored in?

name: samspud
text: A life of basic slavery. It's not that bad
